Articles.Content:
Morimee is a big lumpy ball of rock and shiny blue stuff, orbiting out a little bit further than Eeloo. Morimee has three moons, Panca, Puck and Wotwey.

The Morimee system is loosely based on the real-life Quaoar system, but is really only similar in size.

https://discord.gg/afcWvjx The Morimee Discord I threw together in 5 minutes

https://spacedock.info/mod/2057/Morimee System Download link. Requires Kopernicus and ModuleManager (downloaded separately)

https://imgur.com/gallery/FOQbtLk Pics for Clicks

Just a note, this mod will be updated to have more stuff. suggest anything that you want on this thread or on the Discord and it'll probably be added in.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1.2 is now out! 1.2 adds another moon to Morimee, Puck, and remakes Morimee's surface. it also fixes the deformity problem with Wotwey's normal map.

Edited February 3, 2019 by Mythical Donuts
updoot
Some images would encourage more people to consider using this mod. Without images or details, most people will entirely skip a planet modpack.

@septemberWavesI've added pictures now

Also, what do you people think of adding a ring system to Morimee?
Interesting-looking planets. And rings are a nice touch; whether to add them or not really depends on what you are going for.
uhh I tried to install but did not work

1 hour ago, bobjonesisthebest:D said:

uhh I tried to install but did not work

Have you got Kopernicus, Modular flight integrator and Module manager? Those are three mods this needs

Hmmm, just found this. 
People haven't been making many planet packs that just add new planets to the stock system in the past few versions.
I'm interested to see what you'll do with it.

Addendum #1

Morimee appears to have a PQS surface texture, different from what us seen in scaled space. 

Panca needs to have  it's "maxzoom" adjusted so that you can properly see it in map view. 

Wotweys deformity on the surface looks a loot less than what is seen in map view
